properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 3:29 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-08T00:01:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T21:29:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2294443955.2020
Area: Flagstaff Co. near Forestburg and Galahad, Flagstaff Co. near Alliance and Bellshill Lake, M.D. of Provost near Hughenden Amisk and Kessler, M.D. of Provost near Czar Metiskow and Cadogan
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Sasktel Planned Service Outage In And Around Biggar
properties.Summary:
Description: On July 8th, from 12:00 am (midnight) until approximately 6:00 am, SaskTel crews will be performing maintenance on the network infrastructure serving the Town of Biggar and surrounding area. During that timeframe, SaskTel Internet, Wireless, and Landline Phone services will be unavailable in and around Biggar.
Expires: 2020-07-08T10:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK SaskTel, 2020-07-07T10:03:49-06:00, 0ADAAC97-4B0F-FC89-B4CA-369528489CB4
Area: Town of Biggar
properties.Author: SK SaskTel

properties.Title: Cancelled: Flood Warning Ended For The Assiniboine River From Brandon To Portage La Prairie.
properties.Summary:
Description: Cancelled: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. The Flood Warning for the Assiniboine River from Brandon to Portage la Prairie has ended. If you are in the affected area, please remain watchful of local waterways. There is a potential for overland flooding in low lying areas. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Use caution when driving on all roads as road conditions may have changed. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by local authorities, listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Stay tuned to local media for updates.
Expires: 2020-07-07T17:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-07-07T14:45:59-05:00, D166686D-7A31-B057-8D39-4F5733E81E07
Area: Assiniboine River from Brandon to Portage la Prairie
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of hot weather is expected. Daytime high temperatures reaching near 29 degrees Celsius will begin Wednesday. Overnight low temperatures of near 18 degrees Celsius will provide little relief from the heat. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T11:44:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T19:45:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3320734635.2020
Area: Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki, Fort Albany, Moosonee
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: Flood Warning Continued For The Whitemud River And Little Saskatchewan River Watersheds.
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure’s Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a Flood Warning for the Little Saskatchewan River and the Whitemud River watersheds. The Little Saskatchewan River and the Whitemud River are above flood stages and low-lying land near the rivers are affected. If you are in the affected area, be watchful as local waterways are expected to rise quickly and may cause flooding. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Use caution when driving on all roads as road conditions may have changed. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by local authorities and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Stay tuned to local media for updates. Up to date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca
Expires: 2020-07-09T16:00:00-05:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2020-07-07T14:47:16-05:00, 6BF71EE5-D42A-B7D1-1537-C07EC6F44B1F
Area: Little Saskatchewan River and Whitemud River Watersheds
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A period of hot weather today and continuing this week. Daytime high temperatures in excess of 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the high thirties to low forties, are expected this week. Overnight lows near 20 degrees Celsius are also expected through this period, providing little relief from the heat. A slightly cooler airmass may move into the area this weekend, however there is considerable uncertainty. A few areas towards eastern Ontario are likely to experience extreme heat on Saturday as well. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T11:21:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T19:22:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3327580466.2020

properties.Title: Tornado Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms which may produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorms will develop in the late afternoon and will initially be discrete before coalescing into a line in the evening and overnight period. During the initial convective period, as these storms are discrete, there will be an enhanced risk for tornadoes to form with these severe thunderstorms. There is the risk for a long track tornado with the development of these supercells. ### This is a dangerous and potentially life-threatening situation. Tornado watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce tornadoes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T01:04:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T17:15:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3505958722.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Heat event continues through the end of the week. Daytime high temperatures near 30 degrees Celsius with humidex values in the low to mid thirties are forecast over the next several days. Overnight low temperatures in the mid to upper teens are also expected during this period. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 1:56 p.m. MDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to toonie size hail and heavy rain. A severe thunderstorm has developed 30 km southeast of Onefour and is moving towards the northeast at 45 km/h. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. With an approaching low pressure system, severe thunderstorms will develop over the southwestern portion of SK. These thunderstorms will initially be discrete before coalescing into a line in the late evening and overnight period. This watch area will likely be expanded to the west as the situation develops. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts, damaging hail and heavy rain. Numerous thunderstorms will track across Western and Northern Quebec today. Severe thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong wind gusts over bodies of water. ### Very large hail can damage property, break windows, dent vehicles and cause serious injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Oppressive heat wave A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will continue over the next few days. Beginning today, temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and will not fall below 20 degrees at night. The combined temperature and humidity values will give humidex values of 40. These conditions could last into Saturday. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Heat warnings are issued when very high temperature or humidity conditions are expected to pose an elevated risk of heat illnesses, such as heat stroke or heat exhaustion. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A heat wave is expected this week. A warm and humid air mass over Southern Quebec will persist over the next few days. The heat wave will continue north of Montreal. Temperatures will exceed the 30-degree mark during the day and will not fall below 18 degrees at night. Combined values of the temperature and the humidity will give a humidex value of 40. These conditions are likely to persist into Saturday. During times of high heat, your health and the health of your family and friends can deteriorate rapidly. The ministère de la Santé et des Services sociaux du Québec, in cooperation with Environment and Climate Change Canada, recommends that you protect yourself from the effects of the heat by taking the following actions: Drink 6 to 8 glasses of water per day. As appropriate, follow your physician's instructions regarding the amount of fluid to drink; Avoid alcoholic beverages; Spend at least 2 hours a day in an air conditioned or cool place; Take at least one cool shower or bath per day, or cool your skin several times per day with wet towels; Limit physical activity; Wear light clothes. Be sure to: Never leave a child or a baby alone in a vehicle or a poorly ventilated room, even for a few minutes; Check on your loved ones, especially those who are vulnerable or living alone. If you have any questions regarding your health, call Info-Santé by dialing 8-1-1 or ask a health care provider. In case of emergency, call 9-1-1. For more information, visit the Government of Quebec's Portail santé mieux-être at www.sante.gouv.qc.ca. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T11:22:33-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-07T19:23:33-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1096733288.2020

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A prolonged period of hot weather will continue through the rest of this week. Daytime high temperatures in excess of 30 degrees Celsius, with humidex values in the high thirties to low forties, are expected this week. Overnight lows near 20 degrees Celsius are also expected through this period, providing little relief from the heat. A slightly cooler airmass may move into the area this weekend, however there is considerable uncertainty and the conditions may persist for a few areas into Saturday. Please refer to your public forecast for further details on expected temperatures. Hot and humid air can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index approaching the high risk category. Never leave people or pets inside a parked vehicle. ### Extreme heat affects everyone. The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-08T11:23:21-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Severe thunderstorms may develop early this evening. The severe thunderstorm threat will end near midnight. The main threats are wind gusting to 90 kilometres per hour and heavy downpours giving up to 50 millimetres of rain within an hour. ### Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
